medical_history.chief_complaint: Abdominal pain, nausea, vomiting, and diarrhea.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The symptoms began 2 days prior, with sharp and constant abdominal pain that worsens in the epigastrium and radiates to the right side and lower quadrants. The pain improved with dilaudid and worsened with eating. The patient experienced up to 10 loose, non-bloody, sometimes watery bowel movements and persistent nausea/vomiting, leading to an inability to tolerate oral intake. Chills were reported.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Celiac Sprue (diagnosed via biopsy), GERD, IBS, eating disorder (now well controlled), chronic anemia, osteoporosis, migraines, chronic arthritis in left knee (with a history of 7 operations), fibromyalgia, and a history of depression and suicide attempts.
medical_history.family_history: Mother died of CHF. Father has bradycardia and a pacemaker. Three healthy sisters.
